text: z  An assessment of the cumulative impacts with other development during construction and operation. z  A statement as to whether the development is or is not consistent with relevant policy,. z  Conclusion of the assessment Section 6 and 7 of the EPUK/IAQM ‘Planning for air quality’ guidance gives more in-depth information on how to address the requirements listed above. Air quality assessments carried out using realistic worst-case assumptions to minimise the uncertainty in the outcomes are considered most robust. If certain parameters are unknown or uncertain, this ensures that the results of the assessment are conservative in nature. BACK TO CONTENTS Air quality assessments should also take into account the cumulative air quality impacts of other development, including developments that are under construction or have been granted planning permission in the vicinity of the proposed development, where practicable.
